conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be traced to determine whether it flows into container D or E.
The image shows three liquid entry points labeled A, B, and C at the top, slanted baffles of various colors guiding the flow, and two containers labeled D and E at the bottom.
Each baffle is slanted and acts as a ramp that directs liquid either to the left or right.
The slanted baffles guide the liquid flow directionally, forcing it to slide left or right as it descends.
Tracing the path from A, the ramps guide the liquid progressively to the left-most outlet, which empties into container D.
Tracing the path from B, the alternating ramps steer the liquid to the second outlet from the left, which also feeds into container D.
Tracing the path from C, the ramps guide the liquid progressively to the right-most outlet, which empties into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A and B flows into container D, and liquid from C flows into container E.
